thread.title: Things We Saw Today: Marvel Announces Official Runaways Cast
thread.title_full: Things We Saw Today: Marvel Announces Official Runaways Cast

author: Keisha Hatchett
title: Things We Saw Today: Marvel Announces Official Runaways Cast
text:
Things are really coming together for Marvel’s new TV series Runaways , set to be released on Hulu. Based on the comic of the same name, it centers on a group of teens who don’t really like each other but must unite to take down a common enemy–their parents. The official cast has been announced and you might recognize a few faces. Teen Wolf’s Rhenzy Feliz will play proud nerd Alex Wilder while Lyrica Okano is set to take on the role of Nico Minoru, a tough and independent Wiccan full of the teen angst Nirvana often sang about. Check out the rest of the cast here . (via Marvel)
Harriet Tubman and other take center stage in new Underground season two posters. (via TV Line) Ever wondered what would happen if Darth Vader took on Buzz Lightyear? Well, now you don’t have to . (via Laughing Squid) Angelina Jolie penned an essay in response to Donald Trump’s immigration ban. (via New York Times) Alt-right, alt-right, alt-right…Matthew McConaughey thinks it’s time for us to embrace Donald Trump as president. Sure, I’ll embrace the man determined to roll back my rights and those of other marginalized communities with no regard for our planet and its inhabitants the day he decides to open a book and find a clue. (via Vulture) More than 70 protesters were arrested at Standing Rock as Dakota Access prepares to finish that potentially harmful pipeline. (via The Guardian) For those in a giving mood, support Cuties , a “queer owned and operated coffee bar and community space in Los Angeles.” (via Indiegogo) We hope you enjoy this montage of every movie that has won an Academy Award for Best Cinematography. (via Laughing Squid) Following in Paris Is Burning’s footsteps, Kiki is a documentary about of group of LGBTQIA POC whov’e created a safe space for them selves. (via YouTube) More than 400 gathered in Los Angeles for SAG-AFTRA’s strike against certain video game companies. (via Deadline) After public outcry, Republican lawmaker Jason Chaffetz has withdrawn his bill to sell federal lands. (via Fortune) Similarly, Uber CEO Travis Kalanick is stepping down from Donald J. Trump’s economic advisory council following criticism and #DeleteUber. (via New York Times) Oh, and Disney CEO Bob Iger decided not to attend a planned White House meeting with Trump. (via Deadline) That’s it on our end. What did you all see?
(image via Marvel)
